economic_context.details: Claudon was angry about land rental by Demenge Colas Girard - land was next to Claudon's and he had been gradually encroaching while it was disused. Demengeon Claude Girard lost barley worth 300 francs to hail. Witness Jean Thierion accused of stealing two sacks at market. Economic status indicators: Claudon described as among 'the richest' who 'pushed aside the poor'; he was traveling to buy grain at Raon to sell at profit at St Dié

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony and torture confession. Notable for accused's reputation as wealthy and careful to avoid quarrels. Confession included sabbat attendance and accomplice naming. Trial proceeded quickly from informations (April 22) to execution (May 18).
